name: Villain Type Generator
explanation: This generator produces a quick personality for a new villain based on villain achetype.
source: Villain archetypes and descriptions from 'The Villain: Archetypes', by Word Hunter (WordPress) 8/8/2016.

tables.name: authorityChar
entries:
Other names: Career Bitch, The Abusive Autocrat, Dictator 
1) Corporate Climber with no morals or loyalty 
2) Holds on to power at any cost 
2) Collects sycophants who protect them 
Goal: climb to the top and stay there

tables.name: beastChar
entries:
Other names: the Monster 
1) Literally a monster with a limited mind of its own 
2) Can be heroic but misunderstood like Godzila 
Goal: feed or protect territory

tables.name: bigbadChar
entries:
Other names: power behind the throne, hidden darkness 
1) Superior to other villains 
2) Shrouds themselves in secrecy 
3) Sub-Commanders are Dragons 
Goals: maintain secrecy, oppose heroes once aware of them

tables.name: bullyChar
entries:
1) Opposes heroes directly, tormenting them intentionally 
2) Probably suffered abuse as a child 
3) May be a psychopath or sociopath 
Goal: tormant and obstruct heroes

tables.name: corruptedChar
entries:
Other names: once were good/bad politicians 
1) Started out good or not so bad and were corrupted by criminals, wealth or power 
2) Follows tropes of bad cops, bad politicians 
3) End up serving a mastermaind or big bad 
Goals: protect their secrets and live confortably

tables.name: criminalChar
entries:
Other names: thief, gentleman thief, cat burglar, thug, bankrobber 
1) Works for wealth and power it provides 
2) Can be an anti-villain or anti-hero,  
3) Solitary, but can work in a team under a mastermind or dragon 
4) Can help heroes, but will take steps to ensure they get their share of treasure that can undermine the group 
Goals: money

tables.name: darkknightChar
entries:
Other names: Dr Doom, Absolute Batman 
1) Upholds a strict code of honor that is their own that is incomprehensible to others 
2) Destroys anyone who fails to meet their standards of honor 
3) The ends always justify the means 
Goals: to rid society of everyone who fails to meet his standards of honor

tables.name: disposedheirChar
entries:
Other names: Snubbed Sibling, The Spare 
1) Born to wealth and privilege but prevented from inheriting it 
2) Has the mannerisms and comportment of a noble 
3) Extreme sense of entitlement (spoiled brat) 
4) Chronic resentment of other heir(s) 
Goals: to get back the title(s) they feel they deserve

tables.name: desperadoChar
entries:
1) On the run in their own pitiful world 
2) Could be anyone trapped by their own poor choices 
3) Running from or working for worse villains than themselves 
4) Forced into unscrupulous choices to survive 
Goals: live another day regardless of the cost and escape their fate

tables.name: devilChar
entries:
Other names: Evil Clown, Dark God, Fallen Angel, Demon, Trickster 
1) Literally the Devil on earth in humanoid form or a mind reader 
2) Can spot moral weaknesses in anyone, heroes included 
3) May have morals or principles unlike the Unhinged 
4) Enjoys playing with their 'food' as a dark comedy 
Goals: to tempt and manipulate the hero and their entourage to fall into darkness

tables.name: despotChar
entries:
1) Wants power by any means necessary 
2) Often start off as powerless victims who channel their rage into action 
3) Gathers forces as minions to justify their belief systems and do their dirty work 
4) No amount of power is enough, often conquering nations or continents 
Goals: power over everyone else

tables.name: worlddominatorChar
entries: ultimate power over an entire world, multiple worlds, a plane, multiple planes, or a multiverse

tables.name: dragonChar
entries:
Other names: The Boss 
1) Earned their way to leadership with competence and hard work 
2) Able leader ruling through respect or fear 
3) Understands long term goals 
Goals: take over the organization (secretly in some cases)

tables.name: capodragonChar
entries:
Other names: Capo, Underboss, Subcommander, Darth Vader 
1) Serves the Big Bad and believes in their motives, goals, and endgame 
2) Visible commander of the organization as the Big Bad is rarely seen 
3) So effective at leading that the Big Bad might not be noticed 
4) Only face most minions have ever seen 
Goals: command and enforce the Big Bad's will through the organization

tables.name: equalChar
entries:
Other names: Nemesis, Arch-Enemy, Mirror, General Zod, Reverse Flash 
1) Almost a doppleganger of a specific hero, but differs substantially in morals and ethics 
2) This willian will eclipse others in stories focused on said hero 
3) May ally temporarily with said hero in the face of a world-ending crisis or a crisis created by someone they despise 
Goals: match wits and win against said hero (their arch-enemy) 
Note: This is rarely seen outside of superhero and thriller genres.
